attributes.action: Help get housing adaptations for the disabled when needed
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
My name is Hannah. I'm a married Mum of 3 who recently found out my life would change forever through disability.

I suffered nerve damage to my spine & leg during a knee stabilisation procedure. The nerve damage has caused extra problems such as CRPS (complex regional pain syndrome) muscle wastage, paresthesia & osteoporosis.

I was assessed by the occupational therapist. Her recommendations were an extension for ground floor accomodation, downstairs wetroom, a disabled friendly kitchen & a driveway. This was to be done via a disabled facilities grant.

An application was made. UK law states they have to respond within 6 months.20 months later & nothing.

It is happening to alot of housing authority tenants. Local authorities have a public duty as stated by law to promote disability & the welfare of the disabled. It is clear they are not fulfilling their duties.
